sources.data_found: In 2023, 65 degrees were awarded to men at University of Tulsa in Computer Science, which is 9.29 times more than the 7 female recipients with that same degree.
University of Tulsa has a total enrollment of 3,559 including 2,485 undergraduate students and 1,074 graduate students.

Students and faculty pursue their lines of inquiry with the benefit of a dedicated research network that hosts a private multi-tenant cloud and a collection of experimental high-performance computing platforms.

The Tandy Supercomputing Center holds 100 nodes with 128 GB of RAM, comprised of two 2.7 GHz Intel Xeon CPUs each running Red Hat Linux for a total of 1600 cores with about 30 Teraflops at current capacity.

The Tandy School of Computer Science offers cutting edge programs leading to a bachelor of science degree in computer science (CS) and computer simulation and gaming (CSG). In addition the Tandy School of Computer Science offers both a master of science and doctoral degree.

OUPI is home to the OU-Tulsa Accelerated Composable Computing System (OU-TACCS). This system provides state-of-the-art resources for machine learning and artificial intelligence coursework and research. Dedicated to OUPI, this system provides an array of accelerated computing modules (GPUs)

Computer Simulation & Gaming (CSG) Studio state-of-the-art lab provides exclusive access to industry-standard software and hardware. Equipped with 20 VR-capable gaming PCs, our studio is primed to handle the demands of cutting-edge development.

student_data.notes: Based on 72 total CS degrees awarded in 2023 (65 men, 7 women). Estimated breakdown: Assuming typical 4-year undergrad program = ~260 undergrad CS majors (72 degrees/year × ~3.6 years average). Graduate/PhD estimates based on typical university distribution where grad programs are ~22% of total CS enrollment and PhD ~6%. Total CS enrollment estimated at ~352 students.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: CSG Studio has 20 VR-capable gaming PCs. Specific GPU models not disclosed.

gpu_resources.notes: University of Tulsa mentions having 'dedicated research network that hosts a private multi-tenant cloud and a collection of experimental high-performance computing platforms' but specific GPU specifications are not publicly available. The historical Tandy Supercomputing Center (community collaboration) had 100 CPU nodes but no GPUs mentioned. Current HPC/GPU resources not found in public sources. OU-TACCS system mentioned for OU-Tulsa campus includes GPUs but specific models/counts not disclosed.

analysis_notes: University of Tulsa has relatively small CS enrollment with 72 degrees awarded in 2023. While they mention having HPC resources and a dedicated research network, specific GPU cluster configurations are not publicly documented. The CSG Studio has 20 VR-capable gaming workstations but enterprise GPU specifications were not found.
